result.execSummary:
The defendant Janell A. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination to equal fulltime.
No violent or abusive contact with S.A.R.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
Participate in Parenting Classes if agent believes necessary after considering other Parenting classes she may have taken. 
Comply with outstanding CHIPS order. 
If successfully completes and agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Comply with conditions on Count 1. 
If successfully completes and agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation Early Discharge Recommendation with attached supporting documentation

on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation /s/ RJS 02/11/16 - The petition is GRANTED.  The period of probation is modified to discharge the defendant from probation supervision on March 15, 2016 unless victim objects on or before March 5, 2016

ADDRESS INFO for Janell A. Scott
Current: 4508 Terrace Ln, Apt 1, Stevens Point, WI 54481-5049 United States  (Effective: 02-24-2015)
Prior: 281 Shannon Court Apt. #3, Plover, WI 54467
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Janell A. Scott in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Redfield received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 -
Sentence withtheld. Placed on 24 months probation: 
Maintain fulltime employment or schooling or combination to equal fulltime.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Participate in Parenting classes if agent believes necessary after considering other parenting classes she may have taken.
Comply with outstanding CHIPS order.
No violent or abusive contact with S.A.R.
Pay costs. 
If successfully completes and agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge. 

Count 2 -
Sentence withheld.  Placed on 24 months probation, concurrent to Count 1. 
Comply with conditions on Count 1.
Pay costs.
If successfully completes and agent recommends, the Court will consider early discharge.
Plea hearing on September 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Janell A. Scott and Atty Redfield are not in court. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Knaapen states that a waiver was filed or will be filed by Atty Redfield and requests an arraignment will be scheduled. Court grants matter to be be scheduled for Arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$2,000 sig bond: No abusive contact with S.A.R and follow any order under any CHIPS proceeding.

Court calls case at 1:59 PM Defendant Janell A. Scott in court with attorney Jared C Redfield. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
States request $2,000 sig bond: No abusive contact with S.A.R follow any order under any CHIPS proceeding.

BTC:  $2,000 sig bond: No abusive contact with S.A.R and follow any order under any CHIPS proceeding.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Isherwood indicates Atty Knaapen and Atty Redfield have requested to adjourn to next week.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
